meanings.definition: The decomposition of organic materials at high temperatures in the absence of oxygen.
meanings.sent1: During the pyrolysis of wood, it breaks down into charcoal and other substances.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study pyrolysis to understand how organic matter transforms under extreme heat.
meanings.sent3: At the campfire, the pyrolysis of marshmallows turned them into crispy treats.
meanings.sent4: The pyrolysis of the fallen leaves in autumn created a rich, earthy scent in the air.
meanings.sent5: The pyrolysis of the plastic bottle in the fire released toxic fumes into the environment.

meanings.definition: The process of heating organic materials to produce a chemical change.
meanings.sent1: In the lab, researchers use pyrolysis to convert biomass into biofuels.
meanings.sent2: Farmers utilize pyrolysis to turn agricultural waste into valuable resources.
meanings.sent3: The chef's accidental pyrolysis of the sugar resulted in a burnt dessert.
meanings.sent4: The pyrolysis of the clay in the kiln transformed it into a durable ceramic vase.
meanings.sent5: The pyrolysis of the wood chips released a pleasant aroma in the workshop.
